alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 28 at 11:50AM EDT until March 28 at 12:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Eastern Carbon County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Southwestern Monroe County in northeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 1215 PM EDT. * At 1149 AM EDT, a dangerous snow squall was located near White Haven, or 15 miles north of Lehighton, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Expect hazardous road conditions. * This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 75 and 97. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 277 and 286. Locations impacted include... Jim Thorpe, Penn Forest Reservoir, Albrightsville, Beltzville State Park, Lake Harmony, Christmans, Jonas, Meckesville, Parryville, Weissport East and Merwinsburg. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for sudden loss of traction.
